intro: Lycopsis axillaris, commonly known as the axillary lycopsis, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its fruit is a small, dry schizocarp that splits into two parts when mature.
